intro: Trichodiadema inornatum, commonly known as the Cape snowball, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with dense clusters of white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically blue-green in color and covered in fine, white hairs. Trichodiadema inornatum is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
